Using a Banner option within sshd_config causes the connection to fail

```
Banner /etc/ssh/banner
```

If we comment out the Banner line, and restart sshd, client connections work just fine.

Steps to reproduce
------------------

```powershell
PS /Users/drewstinnett> Enter-PSSession -Host host.example.com -SSHTransport -UserName drews
Enter-PSSession : The background process reported an error with the following message: The SSH client session has ended with error message:
####
# Example Banner
####
At line:1 char:1
+ Enter-PSSession -Host host.example.com -SSHTransport -UserNam ...
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : ResourceUnavailable: (:) [Enter-PSSession], PSRemotingTransportException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : System.Management.Automation.Remoting.PSRemotingDataStructureException,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.EnterPSSessionCommand

PS /Users/drewstinnett>

```

Expected behavior
-----------------

```powershell
PS /Users/drewstinnett> Enter-PSSession -Host host.example.com -SSHTransport -UserName drews
####
# Example Banner
####
[host.example.com]: PS /home/drews>
```

Actual behavior
---------------

```powershell
PS /Users/drewstinnett> Enter-PSSession -Host host.example.com -SSHTransport -UserName drews
Enter-PSSession : The background process reported an error with the following message: The SSH client session has ended with error message:
####
# Example Banner
####
At line:1 char:1
+ Enter-PSSession -Host host.example.com -SSHTransport -UserNam ...
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : ResourceUnavailable: (:) [Enter-PSSession], PSRemotingTransportException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : System.Management.Automation.Remoting.PSRemotingDataStructureException,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.EnterPSSessionCommand

PS /Users/drewstinnett>
```

comments.author: PaulHigin
comments.body:
PowerShell currently uses stderror messages to determine if ssh client fails during remoting initial connection, such as an authorization failure or some configuration caused failure, and then reports the failure message to the user.  But this is turning out to be unreliable since ssh passes warnings and (now) banner text stderror too.

The banner text comes through stderror and PowerShell cannot distinguish it from a real ssh error, so it closes the session.  PowerShell currently looks for "WARNING:" prepended to a stderror message and ignores those.  But I don't see a way to ignore a random string appearing in stderror.

This is only for the initial connection and the protocol handles connection errors after that.  I think we will need to add some kind of connection integrity check before starting the protocol to ensure the initial connection succeeded.  It will involve ensuring the ssh client process is alive since it will terminate on error.

In the mean time the workaround is to not turn on the banner message for sshd configuration.

comments.author: thukk
comments.body:
Any update on progress with this bug?  This issue also happens when attempting to created a connection from Linux to Linux.  I can bypass the SSH prompt by setting no banner in sssh_config, but if FIPs Mode is enabled, the connection errors out as SSH says "The background process reported an error with the following message: The SSH client session has ended with error message: FIPS mode initialized."

Even if it writes to `stderr`, that is fine - but at least make it respect the ErrorAction setting (it currently Stops, regardless of the set Error Action).  That would be bare minimum.
